info.title: Sui JSON-RPC
info.description: Sui JSON-RPC API for interaction with Sui Full node.

methods.name: sui_batchTransaction
methods.description: Create an unsigned batched transaction.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: single_transaction_params
params.description: list of transaction request parameters

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: txn_builder_mode
params.description: Whether this is a regular transaction or a Dev Inspect Transaction

arguments: An NFT created by the Sui Command Line Tool

methods.name: sui_devInspectTransaction
methods.description: Runs the transaction in dev-inspect mode. Which allows for nearly any transaction (or Move call) with any arguments. Detailed results are provided, including both the transaction effects and any return values.

params.name: tx_bytes
params.description: BCS encoded TransactionKind(as opposed to TransactionData, which include gasBudget and gasPrice)

params.name: gas_price
params.description: Gas is not charged, but gas usage is still calculated. Default to use reference gas price

params.name: epoch
params.description: The epoch to perform the call. Will be set from the system state object if not provided

methods.name: sui_dryRunTransaction
methods.description: Return transaction execution effects including the gas cost summary, while the effects are not committed to the chain.

methods.name: sui_executeTransaction
methods.description: Execute the transaction and wait for results if desired. Request types: 1. WaitForEffectsCert: waits for TransactionEffectsCert and then return to client.     This mode is a proxy for transaction finality. 2. WaitForLocalExecution: waits for TransactionEffectsCert and make sure the node     executed the transaction locally before returning the client. The local execution     makes sure this node is aware of this transaction when client fires subsequent queries.     However if the node fails to execute the transaction locally in a timely manner,     a bool type in the response is set to false to indicated the case. request_type is default to be `WaitForEffectsCert` unless options.show_events or options.show_effects is true

params.name: tx_bytes
params.description: BCS serialized transaction data bytes without its type tag, as base-64 encoded string.

params.name: signatures
params.description: A list of signatures (`flag || signature || pubkey` bytes, as base-64 encoded string). Signature is committed to the intent message of the transaction data, as base-64 encoded string.

params.name: options
params.description: options for specifying the content to be returned

params.name: request_type
params.description: The request type, derived from `SuiTransactionResponseOptions` if None

examples.name: Execute an transaction with serialized signatures

methods.name: sui_getAllBalances
methods.description: Return the total coin balance for all coin type, owned by the address owner.

params.name: owner
params.description: the owner's Sui address

methods.name: sui_getAllCoins
methods.description: Return all Coin objects owned by an address.

params.name: owner
params.description: the owner's Sui address

params.name: cursor
params.description: optional paging cursor

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of items per page

methods.name: sui_getBalance
methods.description: Return the total coin balance for one coin type, owned by the address owner.

params.name: owner
params.description: the owner's Sui address

params.name: coin_type
params.description: optional type names for the coin (e.g., 0x168da5bf1f48dafc111b0a488fa454aca95e0b5e::usdc::USDC), default to 0x2::sui::SUI if not specified.

methods.name: sui_getCheckpoint
methods.description: Return a checkpoint

params.name: id
params.description: Checkpoint identifier, can use either checkpoint digest, or checkpoint sequence number as input.

methods.name: sui_getCoinMetadata
methods.description: Return metadata(e.g., symbol, decimals) for a coin

params.name: coin_type
params.description: type name for the coin (e.g., 0x168da5bf1f48dafc111b0a488fa454aca95e0b5e::usdc::USDC)

methods.name: sui_getCoins
methods.description: Return all Coin<`coin_type`> objects owned by an address.

params.name: owner
params.description: the owner's Sui address

params.name: coin_type
params.description: optional type name for the coin (e.g., 0x168da5bf1f48dafc111b0a488fa454aca95e0b5e::usdc::USDC), default to 0x2::sui::SUI if not specified.

params.name: cursor
params.description: optional paging cursor

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of items per page

methods.name: sui_getCommitteeInfo
methods.description: Return the committee information for the asked `epoch`.

params.name: epoch
params.description: The epoch of interest. If None, default to the latest epoch

methods.name: sui_getDelegatedStakes
methods.description: Return all [DelegatedStake].

methods.name: sui_getDynamicFieldObject
methods.description: Return the dynamic field object information for a specified object

params.name: parent_object_id
params.description: The ID of the queried parent object

params.name: name
params.description: The Name of the dynamic field

methods.name: sui_getDynamicFields
methods.description: Return the list of dynamic field objects owned by an object.

params.name: parent_object_id
params.description: The ID of the parent object

params.name: cursor
params.description: Optional paging cursor

params.name: limit
params.description: Maximum item returned per page, default to [QUERY_MAX_RESULT_LIMIT] if not specified.

methods.name: sui_getEvents
methods.description: Return list of events for a specified query criteria.

params.name: query
params.description: the event query criteria.

params.name: cursor
params.description: optional paging cursor

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of items per page, default to [QUERY_MAX_RESULT_LIMIT] if not specified.

params.name: descending_order
params.description: query result ordering, default to false (ascending order), oldest record first.

examples.name: Return the Events emitted by a transaction

methods.name: sui_getTotalSupply

methods.name: sui_getTransactions
methods.description: Return list of transactions for a specified query criteria.

params.name: query
params.description: the transaction query criteria.

params.name: cursor
params.description: Optional paging cursor

params.name: limit
params.description: Maximum item returned per page, default to QUERY_MAX_RESULT_LIMIT if not specified.

params.name: descending_order
params.description: query result ordering, default to false (ascending order), oldest record first.

examples.name: Return the transaction digest for specified query criteria

methods.name: sui_getTransactionsInRangeDeprecated
methods.description: Return list of transaction digests within the queried range. This method will be removed before April 2023, please use `getTransactions` instead

params.name: start
params.description: the matching transactions' sequence number will be greater than or equals to the starting sequence number

params.name: end
params.description: the matching transactions' sequence number will be less than the ending sequence number

methods.name: sui_mergeCoins
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to merge multiple coins into one coin.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: primary_coin
params.description: the coin object to merge into, this coin will remain after the transaction

params.name: coin_to_merge
params.description: the coin object to be merged, this coin will be destroyed, the balance will be added to `primary_coin`

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

methods.name: sui_moveCall
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to execute a Move call on the network, by calling the specified function in the module of a given package.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: package_object_id
params.description: the Move package ID, e.g. `0x2`

params.name: module
params.description: the Move module name, e.g. `devnet_nft`

params.name: function
params.description: the move function name, e.g. `mint`

params.name: type_arguments
params.description: the type arguments of the Move function

params.name: arguments
params.description: the arguments to be passed into the Move function, in [SuiJson](https://docs.sui.io/build/sui-json) format

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: execution_mode
params.description: Whether this is a Normal transaction or a Dev Inspect Transaction. Default to be `SuiTransactionBuilderMode::Commit` when it's None.

methods.name: sui_multiGetObjects
methods.description: Return the object data for a list of objects

params.name: object_ids
params.description: the IDs of the queried objects

params.name: options
params.description: options for specifying the content to be returned

methods.name: sui_multiGetTransactions
methods.description: Returns an ordered list of transaction responses The method will throw an error if the input contains any duplicate or the input size exceeds QUERY_MAX_RESULT_LIMIT

params.name: digests
params.description: A list of transaction digests.

params.name: options
params.description: config options to control which fields to fetch

methods.name: sui_pay
methods.description: Send `Coin<T>` to a list of addresses, where `T` can be any coin type, following a list of amounts, The object specified in the `gas` field will be used to pay the gas fee for the transaction. The gas object can not appear in `input_coins`. If the gas object is not specified, the RPC server will auto-select one.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: input_coins
params.description: the Sui coins to be used in this transaction

params.name: recipients
params.description: the recipients' addresses, the length of this vector must be the same as amounts.

params.name: amounts
params.description: the amounts to be transferred to recipients, following the same order

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

methods.name: sui_payAllSui
methods.description: Send all SUI coins to one recipient. This is for SUI coin only and does not require a separate gas coin object. Specifically, what pay_all_sui does are: 1. accumulate all SUI from input coins and deposit all SUI to the first input coin 2. transfer the updated first coin to the recipient and also use this first coin as gas coin object. 3. the balance of the first input coin after tx is sum(input_coins) - actual_gas_cost. 4. all other input coins other than the first are deleted.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: input_coins
params.description: the Sui coins to be used in this transaction, including the coin for gas payment.

params.name: recipient
params.description: the recipient address,

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

methods.name: sui_paySui
methods.description: Send SUI coins to a list of addresses, following a list of amounts. This is for SUI coin only and does not require a separate gas coin object. Specifically, what pay_sui does are: 1. debit each input_coin to create new coin following the order of amounts and assign it to the corresponding recipient. 2. accumulate all residual SUI from input coins left and deposit all SUI to the first input coin, then use the first input coin as the gas coin object. 3. the balance of the first input coin after tx is sum(input_coins) - sum(amounts) - actual_gas_cost 4. all other input coints other than the first one are deleted.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: input_coins
params.description: the Sui coins to be used in this transaction, including the coin for gas payment.

params.name: recipients
params.description: the recipients' addresses, the length of this vector must be the same as amounts.

params.name: amounts
params.description: the amounts to be transferred to recipients, following the same order

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.description: the compiled bytes of a move module, the

params.name: gas

params.name: gas_budget

methods.name: sui_subscribeEvent
methods.description: Subscribe to a stream of Sui event

params.name: filter

methods.name: sui_transferObject
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to transfer an object from one address to another. The object's type must allow public transfers

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: object_id
params.description: the ID of the object to be transferred

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: recipient
params.description: the recipient's Sui address

methods.name: sui_transferSui
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to send SUI coin object to a Sui address. The SUI object is also used as the gas object.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: sui_object_id
params.description: the Sui coin object to be used in this transaction

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: recipient
params.description: the recipient's Sui address

params.name: amount
params.description: the amount to be split out and transferred

methods.name: sui_tryGetPastObject
methods.description: Note there is no software-level guarantee/SLA that objects with past versions can be retrieved by this API, even if the object and version exists/existed. The result may vary across nodes depending on their pruning policies. Return the object information for a specified version

params.name: object_id
params.description: the ID of the queried object

params.name: version
params.description: the version of the queried object. If None, default to the latest known version

params.name: options
params.description: options for specifying the content to be returned

methods.name: sui_tryMultiGetPastObjects
methods.description: Note there is no software-level guarantee/SLA that objects with past versions can be retrieved by this API, even if the object and version exists/existed. The result may vary across nodes depending on their pruning policies. Return the object information for a specified version

params.name: past_objects
params.description: a vector of object and versions to be queried

params.name: options
params.description: options for specifying the content to be returned

AuthorityPublicKeyBytes.description: Defines the compressed version of the public key that we pass around in Sui

BigInt.description: Type for de/serializing number to string

endOfEpochData.description: Present only on the final checkpoint of the epoch.

epochRollingGasCostSummary.description: The running total gas costs of all transactions included in the current epoch so far until this checkpoint.

networkTotalTransactions.description: Total number of transactions committed since genesis, including those in this checkpoint.

timestampMs.description: Timestamp of the checkpoint - number of milliseconds from the Unix epoch Checkpoint timestamps are monotonic, but not strongly monotonic - subsequent checkpoints can have same timestamp if they originate from the same underlining consensus commit

CompressedSignature.description: Unlike [enum Signature], [enum CompressedSignature] does not contain public key.

DevInspectResults.description: The response from processing a dev inspect transaction

effects.description: Summary of effects that likely would be generated if the transaction is actually run. Note however, that not all dev-inspect transactions are actually usable as transactions so it might not be possible actually generate these effects from a normal transaction.

events.description: Events that likely would be generated if the transaction is actually run.

results.description: Execution results (including return values) from executing the transaction commands

ECMHLiveObjectSetDigest.description: The Sha256 digest of an EllipticCurveMultisetHash committing to the live object set.

epoch_commitments.description: Commitments to epoch specific state (e.g. live object set)

next_epoch_committee.description: next_epoch_committee is `Some` if and only if the current checkpoint is the last checkpoint of an epoch. Therefore next_epoch_committee can be used to pick the last checkpoint of an epoch, which is often useful to get epoch level summary stats like total gas cost of an epoch, or the total number of transactions from genesis to the end of an epoch. The committee is stored as a vector of validator pub key and stake pairs. The vector should be sorted based on the Committee data structure.

next_epoch_protocol_version.description: The protocol version that is in effect during the epoch that starts immediately after this checkpoint.

oneOf.description: Move-specific event
Module published
Coin balance changing event
Epoch change
New checkpoint
Transfer objects to new address / wrap in another object / coin
Object mutated.
Delete object
New object creation

id.description: Sequential event ID, ie (transaction seq number, event seq number). 1) Serves as a unique event ID for each fullnode 2) Also serves to sequence events for the purposes of pagination and querying. A higher id is an event seen later by that fullnode. This ID is the "cursor" for event querying.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp in milliseconds since epoch (1/1/1970)

oneOf.description: Move StructTag string value of the event type e.g. `0x2::devnet_nft::MintNFTEvent`

EventID.description: Unique ID of a Sui Event, the ID is a combination of tx seq number and event seq number, the ID is local to this particular fullnode and will be different from other fullnode.

oneOf.description: Return all events.
Return events emitted by the given transaction.
Return events emitted in a specified Move module
Return events with the given move event struct name
Query by sender address.
Query by recipient address.
Return events associated with the given object
Return events emitted in [start_time, end_time] interval

endTime.description: right endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since epoch, exclusive

startTime.description: left endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since epoch, inclusive

oneOf.description: Transaction level event Move-specific event
Module published
Coin balance changing event
Epoch change
New checkpoint
Object level event Transfer objects to new address / wrap in another object
Object level event Object mutated.
Delete object
New object creation

GenericSignature.description: Due to the incompatibility of [enum Signature] (which dispatches a trait that assumes signature and pubkey bytes for verification), here we add a wrapper enum where member can just implement a lightweight [trait AuthenticatorTrait]. This way MultiSig (and future Authenticators) can implement its own `verify`.

objectId.description: the ID of the queried object

version.description: the version of the queried object.

MultiSig.description: The struct that contains signatures and public keys necessary for authenticating a MultiSig.

bitmap.description: A bitmap that indicates the position of which public key the signature should be authenticated with.

multisig_pk.description: The public key encoded with each public key with its signature scheme used along with the corresponding weight.

sigs.description: The plain signature encoded with signature scheme.

MultiSigPublicKey.description: The struct that contains the public key used for authenticating a MultiSig.

pk_map.description: A list of public key and its corresponding weight.

threshold.description: If the total weight of the public keys corresponding to verified signatures is larger than threshold, the MultiSig is verified.

bcs.description: Move object content or package content in BCS, default to be None unless SuiObjectDataOptions.showBcs is set to true

content.description: Move object content or package content, default to be None unless SuiObjectDataOptions.showContent is set to true

digest.description: Base64 string representing the object digest

display.description: The Display metadata for frontend UI rendering, default to be None unless SuiObjectDataOptions.showContent is set to true This can also be None if the struct type does not have Display defined See more details in <https://forums.sui.io/t/nft-object-display-proposal/4872>

owner.description: The owner of this object. Default to be None unless SuiObjectDataOptions.showOwner is set to true

previousTransaction.description: The digest of the transaction that created or last mutated this object. Default to be None unless SuiObjectDataOptions.showPreviousTransaction is set to true

storageRebate.description: The amount of SUI we would rebate if this object gets deleted. This number is re-calculated each time the object is mutated based on the present storage gas price.

type.description: The type of the object. Default to be None unless SuiObjectDataOptions.showType is set to true

showBcs.description: Whether to show the content in BCS format. Default to be False

showContent.description: Whether to show the content(i.e., package content or Move struct content) of the object. Default to be False

showDisplay.description: Whether to show the Display metadata of the object for frontend rendering. Default to be False

showOwner.description: Whether to show the owner of the object. Default to be False

showPreviousTransaction.description: Whether to show the previous transaction digest of the object. Default to be False

showStorageRebate.description: Whether to show the storage rebate of the object. Default to be False

showType.description: Whether to show the type of the object. Default to be False

digest.description: Base64 string representing the object digest

objectId.description: Hex code as string representing the object id

oneOf.description: Object is exclusively owned by a single address, and is mutable.
Object is exclusively owned by a single object, and is mutable. The object ID is converted to SuiAddress as SuiAddress is universal.
Object is shared, can be used by any address, and is mutable.

initial_shared_version.description: The version at which the object became shared

oneOf.description: Object is immutable, and hence ownership doesn't matter.

Page_for_Coin_and_ObjectID.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor`, if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

Page_for_DynamicFieldInfo_and_ObjectID.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor`, if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

Page_for_EventEnvelope_and_EventID.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor`, if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

Page_for_TransactionDigest_and_Transacti.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor`, if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

Sha3Digest.description: A representation of a SHA3-256 Digest

stakedSuiId.description: ID of the StakedSui receipt object.

SuiArgument.description: An argument to a programmable transaction command

oneOf.description: The gas coin. The gas coin can only be used by-ref, except for with `TransferObjects`, which can use it by-value.
One of the input objects or primitive values (from `ProgrammableTransaction` inputs)
The result of another command (from `ProgrammableTransaction` commands)
Like a `Result` but it accesses a nested result. Currently, the only usage of this is to access a value from a Move call with multiple return values.

decimals.description: Number of decimal places the coin uses.

id.description: Object id for the CoinMetadata object

SuiCommand.description: A single command in a programmable transaction.

oneOf.description: A call to either an entry or a public Move function

`(Vec<forall T:key+store. T>, address)` It sends n-objects to the specified address. These objects must have store (public transfer) and either the previous owner must be an address or the object must be newly created.
`(&mut Coin<T>, u64)` -> `Coin<T>` It splits off some amount into a new coin
`(&mut Coin<T>, Vec<Coin<T>>)` It merges n-coins into the first coin
Publishes a Move package
Upgrades a Move package
`forall T: Vec<T> -> vector<T>` Given n-values of the same type, it constructs a vector. For non objects or an empty vector, the type tag must be specified.

mutableReferenceOutputs.description: The value of any arguments that were mutably borrowed. Non-mut borrowed values are not included

returnValues.description: The return values from the command

SuiProgrammableMoveCall.description: The command for calling a Move function, either an entry function or a public function (which cannot return references).

module.description: The specific module in the package containing the function.

package.description: The package containing the module and function.

type_arguments.description: The type arguments to the function.

SuiSystemStateSummary.description: This is the JSON-RPC type for the SUI system state object. It flattens all fields to make them top-level fields such that it as minimum dependencies to the internal data structures of the SUI system state type.

activeValidators.description: The list of active validators in the current epoch.

epoch.description: The current epoch ID, starting from 0.

epochStartTimestampMs.description: Unix timestamp of the current epoch start

governanceStartEpoch.description: The starting epoch in which various on-chain governance features take effect.

inactivePoolsId.description: ID of the object that maps from a staking pool ID to the inactive validator that has that pool as its staking pool.

pendingActiveValidatorsId.description: ID of the object that contains the list of new validators that will join at the end of the epoch.

pendingActiveValidatorsSize.description: Number of new validators that will join at the end of the epoch.

pendingRemovals.description: Removal requests from the validators. Each element is an index pointing to `active_validators`.

protocolVersion.description: The current protocol version, starting from 1.

referenceGasPrice.description: The reference gas price for the current epoch.

safeMode.description: Whether the system is running in a downgraded safe mode due to a non-recoverable bug. This is set whenever we failed to execute advance_epoch, and ended up executing advance_epoch_safe_mode. It can be reset once we are able to successfully execute advance_epoch.

stakeSubsidyBalance.description: Balance of SUI set aside for stake subsidies that will be drawn down over time.

stakeSubsidyCurrentEpochAmount.description: The amount of stake subsidy to be drawn down per epoch. This amount decays and decreases over time.

stakeSubsidyEpochCounter.description: This counter may be different from the current epoch number if in some epochs we decide to skip the subsidy.

stakingPoolMappingsId.description: ID of the object that maps from staking pool's ID to the sui address of a validator.

systemStateVersion.description: The current version of the system state data structure type.

totalStake.description: Total amount of stake from all active validators at the beginning of the epoch.

validatorCandidatesId.description: ID of the object that stores preactive validators, mapping their addresses to their `Validator ` structs.

validatorReportRecords.description: A map storing the records of validator reporting each other.

oneOf.description: Regular Sui Transactions that are committed on chain
Simulated transaction that allows calling any Move function with arbitrary values.

SuiValidatorSummary.description: This is the JSON-RPC type for the SUI validator. It flattens all inner structures to top-level fields so that they are decoupled from the internal definitions.

exchangeRatesId.description: ID of the exchange rate table object.

exchangeRatesSize.description: Number of exchange rates in the table.

pendingPoolTokenWithdraw.description: Pending pool token withdrawn during the current epoch, emptied at epoch boundaries.

pendingStake.description: Pending stake amount for this epoch.

pendingTotalSuiWithdraw.description: Pending stake withdrawn during the current epoch, emptied at epoch boundaries.

poolTokenBalance.description: Total number of pool tokens issued by the pool.

rewardsPool.description: The epoch stake rewards will be added here at the end of each epoch.

stakingPoolActivationEpoch.description: The epoch at which this pool became active.

stakingPoolDeactivationEpoch.description: The epoch at which this staking pool ceased to be active. `None` = {pre-active, active},

stakingPoolId.description: ID of the staking pool object.

stakingPoolSuiBalance.description: The total number of SUI tokens in this pool.

gas.description: the gas objects to be used

inputObjects.description: objects to be used in this transaction

txBytes.description: BCS serialized transaction data bytes without its type tag, as base-64 encoded string.

TransactionDigest.description: A transaction will have a (unique) digest.

oneOf.description: The response from processing a transaction or a certified transaction

created.description: ObjectRef and owner of new objects created.

deleted.description: Object Refs of objects now deleted (the old refs).

dependencies.description: The set of transaction digests this transaction depends on.

eventsDigest.description: The digest of the events emitted during execution, can be None if the transaction does not emit any event.

executedEpoch.description: The epoch when this transaction was executed.

gasObject.description: The updated gas object reference. Have a dedicated field for convenient access. It's also included in mutated.

mutated.description: ObjectRef and owner of mutated objects, including gas object.

sharedObjects.description: The object references of the shared objects used in this transaction. Empty if no shared objects were used.

unwrapped.description: ObjectRef and owner of objects that are unwrapped in this transaction. Unwrapped objects are objects that were wrapped into other objects in the past, and just got extracted out.

unwrappedThenDeleted.description: Object refs of objects previously wrapped in other objects but now deleted.

wrapped.description: Object refs of objects now wrapped in other objects.

oneOf.description: A system transaction that will update epoch information on-chain.
A system transaction used for initializing the initial state of the chain.
A system transaction marking the start of a series of transactions scheduled as part of a checkpoint
A series of commands where the results of one command can be used in future commands

commands.description: The commands to be executed sequentially. A failure in any command will result in the failure of the entire transaction.

oneOf.description: All transaction hashes.
Query by move function.
Query by input object.
Query by mutated object.
Query by sender address.
Query by recipient address.

checkpoint.description: The checkpoint number when this transaction was included and hence finalized. This is only returned in the read api, not in the transaction execution api.

showEffects.description: Whether to show transaction effects. Default to be False

showEvents.description: Whether to show transaction events. Default to be False

showInput.description: Whether to show transaction input data. Default to be False
